author: @shreyagupta4545
text: Hi Alex, Thanks for the great explaination. When I run this : select  	jobTitle, 	avg(Salary) as avg_salary from  	EmployeeSalary  group by 1 having avg(Salary) > 42000; I get error "Each GROUP BY expression must contain at least one column that is not an outer reference."  But this works fine select  	jobTitle, 	avg(Salary) as avg_salary from  	EmployeeSalary  group by JobTitle having avg(Salary) > 42000;  Do you know why "group by 1" doesnt work here.

text: Noticed that I got HR added in at the end there and it's not exactly like your solution.  I have the syntax exactly like yours too.  SELECT JobTitle, AVG(Salary) FROM [SQL Tutorial].dbo.EmployeeDemographics Join [SQL Tutorial].dbo.EmployeeSalary 	ON [EmployeeDemographics].[EmployeeID] = EmployeeSalary.EmployeeID GROUP BY JobTitle HAVING AVG(Salary) > 45000 ORDER By AVG(Salary)
